00087      * TODO(cleanup): It would make some sense if the result of

00089      * the resulting data structure from calculateLength) could be

00194 
00195     /*
00196      * TODO(cleanup): It looks like there is now no useful reason why
00197      * apps should generate pdus themselves using these routines,
00198      * instead of handing the raw data to SMSDispatcher (and thereby
00199      * have the phone process do the encoding).  Moreover, CDMA now
00200      * has shared state (in the form of the msgId system property)
00201      * which can only be modified by the phone process, and hence
00202      * makes the output of these routines incorrect.  Since they now
00203      * serve no purpose, they should probably just return null
00204      * directly, and be deprecated.  Going further in that direction,
00205      * the above parsers of serialized pdu data should probably also
00206      * be gotten rid of, hiding all but the necessarily visible
00207      * structured data from client apps.  A possible concern with
00208      * doing this is that apps may be using these routines to generate
00209      * pdus that are then sent elsewhere, some network server, for
00210      * example, and that always returning null would thereby break
00211      * otherwise useful apps.
00212      */
00213
